contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses}} {{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} [[Image:Compass Rose English East.svg|thumb|250px|right|A 16-point [[compass rose]] with east highlighted <!-- Highlighting of east is nearly imperceptable -->]] '''East''' is a [[noun]], [[adjective]], or [[adverb]] indicating [[Direction (geometry, geography)|direction]] or [[geography]]. East is one of the four [[cardinal directions]] or [[compass]] points. It is the opposite of [[west]] and is [[perpendicular]] to [[north]] and [[south]]. By [[Norm (sociology)|convention]], the right hand side of a [[map]] is east. To go east using a compass for [[navigation]], set a [[Bearing (navigation)|bearing]] or [[azimuth]] of 90°. East is the direction toward which the [[Earth]] rotates about its [[Axis of rotation|axis]], and therefore the general direction from which the [[Sun]] appears to rise. During the [[Cold War]], "The East" was sometimes used to refer to the [[Warsaw Pact]] and [[People's Republic of China|Communist China]], along with other [[Communist]] nations. Throughout history, the East has also been used by Europeans in reference to the [[Orient]] and [[Asia]]n societies. ==Etymology== The word ''east'' is derived from the [[Proto-Germanic]] *aus-to- or *austra- "east, toward the sunrise", from [[Proto-Indo-European language]] *aus- "to shine," or "dawn".<ref>http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=east&allowed_in_frame=0</ref> ''[[Ēostre]]'', a [[Germanic gods|Germanic goddess]] of dawn, might have been a personification of both dawn and the cardinal points. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Wiktionary}} {{CandODirections}} [[Category:Orientation]]
